review_title: Used to be great, but they've lost their way.
pros: Good therapists, nice gym, lobby and grounds. Good bonus pay when they are hard up (often). There are some really good, caring staff there.
cons: Since it is a joint venture of two other hospitals , it is waaaaay over managed. There are program initiatives from all directions and the nursing staff gets bogged down in paperwork, audits, and deal with bad staff. Patient ratios aren't too bad, but when you're spending so much time away from patients Running around, they don't get the care they need.. The admissions aren't well planned(getting 6 or 7 at once) and there are often times never enough bodies to go around. Once all the management and ancillary staff go home, nurses and techs have to fend for themselves. Some units are more negative than others and there several employee issues that are never dealt with, especially if they are "diverse". Management does their own thing often ignoring common sense suggestions from people doing the patient care. When we balk they all point their finger at each other for blame. No accountability of management. Many patients are too sick still to be getting quality therapy.
